instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.ALL_SYSPWRGD: What is ALL_SYSPWRGD? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYSPWRGD, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V5_S3RS0: What is PP1V5_S3RS0? PP1V5_S3RS0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power green orange light present no fan spin

tried smc bypass fan is on very high no display (my 1stime tried smc bypass)

8.41v pin 1 2 @F7040 <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

<CHIP>U7600</CHIP>
3 = 3.2V
13 = 5.1V
14 = 5.1 V

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_R_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V

L7630 1.0V
L7100 0.9v
L7330 1.3V
L7550 0.006v diode to ground 0.003
L7510 0.008v diode to ground 0.003

is it bad CPU?

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Ivy Bridge CPU has very low values as normal.

If board stays on in SMC bypass mode, there is a problem with SMC some I/V sensor (pages 45/46).
Start checking <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

Post <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> voltages; pins 40, 24, 15, 2, 1.

(SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
If <RESISTOR>R7974</RESISTOR> is good, then missing <SIGNAL>ALL_SYSPWRGD</SIGNAL>.
Do you get <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>?

after i remove <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>   now got  <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.3v
and the fan is spinning.  need to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>?

update i tried ireplace <TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR> <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> missing again

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Forget about it, is not really needed.
Something wrong with its input resistor dividers.

Is the board working now?
Check for video and USB activity.

 but i dont see backlight/display on the screen and keyboard.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Didn't think to test external video?
Also check Caps Lock light reaction.
You didn't say anything about USB activity yet...

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
The above link explains you how to check.
USB power is NOT the same as USB activity.

threads.title: (SOLVED) <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
this solved. found short on <CAPACITOR>C1754</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0</SIGNAL> after this cap removed unable to supply 1.5V
checked <RESISTOR>R7850</RESISTOR> on pin 1 <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0_FET_R</SIGNAL> is 1.5V pin 2 is 0.3v. i just jumper <RESISTOR>R7850</RESISTOR> in order to supply 1.5V to <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3RS0</SIGNAL>
thanks!
